Note: Participant notices a dark vignette around camera display and notes that it helps camera display stand out against background
Participant describes image quality as “pretty good” because they are able to discern person smiling
Participant is impressed with audio and image quality when viewing pictures and videos they’ve captured
Participant was unaware that the screen is only in one eye and only came to that realization when I asked about the screen positioning
Participant is amused by Meta’s tone of voice and mimics it
Participant notices that reading text is difficult and wishes they could zoom in
Participant notices that their glasses picked up another participant’s “Hey Meta” and prompted a question about sending an image on WhatsApp
Participant highly amused by Metas inaccurate comprehension of question
Participant impressed with image quality when asking Meta to show them a picture of something
Participant notices that Meta is laggy and describes it as Meta being overwhelmed
Participant continually adjusting glasses but I’m noticing that participant must do this often since they mainly look down toward ground when reading information on screen
Participant turned volume up with hand gestures and immediately turned it down saying “not that loud”
Participant attempting to pause music but Meta continues to play music
Noticing that battery level for MR display was depleted significantly after capturing images and videos
Participant noticing that MR glasses are laggy and actions take a moment to register - could be because battery is low (currently at 30%)
Switching to glasses 9 from glasses 8 due to glitching and battery issues
Participant notices that Meta is not responsive to their requests to respond to messages from WhatsApp
Participant was successfully able to message in WhatsApp and listen to music after disconnecting WhatsApp and reconnecting it (app seemed to be experiencing issues reading messages aloud to user)
Participant expresses appreciation for navigation feature in map and described it as a “cool experience”
Participant notices a slight tension headache developing and says that might need to take Tylenol after this session
Participant says they are not used to wearing glasses and lifts them from nose bridge to massage face
Participant says eyes feel tired after asking them if they feel like they are squinting their eyes
Participant does not notice any difference in screen quality depending on their seating area in the room
Participant notices that hand gestures accurately capture desired movement through map
Participant claims that Meta “keeps lagging”
Participant expresses overall satisfaction with MR glasses despite “the few glitches”
